articles.title: FiscalNote is wading into the billion-dollar prediction market
articles.summary: FiscalNote, the $1.2B government analytics company, is launching its own prediction market platform to compete with Polymarket and Kalshi. This marks the first major enterprise software company to enter the space, potentially legitimizing prediction markets for institutional clients who wouldn't touch crypto-based platforms.

articles.title: This week: Kash snares $2M to embed prediction markets into social media feeds
articles.summary: Kash just raised $2M to build prediction markets directly into social media feeds, letting users bet on outcomes without leaving their Twitter or TikTok scrolling. This could finally crack mainstream adoption by meeting users where they already spend hours daily, rather than forcing them to download yet another specialized app.

articles.title: Kalshi bets on Neal Katyal in prediction market cases
articles.summary: Kalshi has hired former U.S. Solicitor General Neal Katyal to represent them in their ongoing legal battles over which prediction markets they can operate. This signals Kalshi is preparing for major Supreme Court-level fights that could determine whether prediction markets become mainstream or remain heavily restricted.

articles.title: What Is A Prediction Market?
articles.summary: Prediction markets let people bet real money on future events, from elections to corporate earnings, creating prices that reflect collective wisdom about what will actually happen. These markets consistently outperform polls and expert forecasts because traders put skin in the game, making them essential tools for anyone who wants to understand what's really likely to unfold.

articles.title: Know the Outcome? Don't Trade- CFTC Puts Prediction Markets on Notice
articles.summary: The CFTC is cracking down on traders who place bets on prediction markets after already knowing the outcome, essentially treating it as fraud rather than forecasting. This signals regulators are taking prediction markets seriously enough to police them like traditional financial markets, which could mean more oversight but also more legitimacy for the space.

articles.title: State of the Union draws over $12M in wagers as prediction markets grow
articles.summary: The State of the Union address pulled in over $12M in betting action, marking another milestone for prediction markets moving into mainstream political events. This shows bettors are hungry for ways to wager on politics beyond just elections, opening up a massive new category of markets that platforms can tap year-round.

articles.title: Penn Entertainment Is Staying Away From Prediction Markets
articles.summary: Penn Entertainment has decided not to enter the prediction markets space, bucking the trend of gaming companies rushing into political and event betting. This leaves more runway for pure-play prediction market operators like Kalshi and PredictIt to grab market share without facing competition from a major casino giant with deep pockets and existing customer relationships.

articles.title: "Survivor 50" hasn't aired yet, but Kalshi, Polymarket have picked a winner
articles.summary: Prediction markets on Kalshi and Polymarket are already pricing favorites for Survivor's milestone 50th season before it hits the airwaves. This marks another expansion of entertainment betting beyond traditional sports, showing how prediction markets are becoming the go-to platform for literally any outcome people want to speculate on.

articles.title: Supreme Court Could Decide Future of Sports Prediction Markets
articles.summary: The Supreme Court is weighing a case that could reshape how sports prediction markets operate in the US. A ruling against these markets would crush the growing industry, while a favorable decision could unlock billions in trading volume currently blocked by regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Prediction markets work just like gambling. Kansas, regulate them the same | Opinion
articles.summary: A Kansas opinion piece argues that prediction markets function identically to gambling and should face the same regulatory restrictions. If this logic spreads to other states, it could torpedo the recent momentum behind legalizing prediction markets for political betting and other events.

articles.title: Kalshi sues Utah over efforts to stop prop betting in the state
articles.summary: Kalshi filed a lawsuit against Utah after the state moved to block proposition betting within its borders. This legal battle could set a precedent for how aggressively states can regulate prediction markets, potentially affecting Kalshi's expansion plans and the broader regulatory landscape for political betting platforms.

articles.title: Gov. Cox took aim at sports betting apps. Kalshi is fighting back — in court.
articles.summary: Kalshi is asking a federal judge to block Utah officials from interfering with prediction markets, apparently after the state tried to shut down betting activity within its borders. If successful, this could set a precedent that shields prediction markets from state-level crackdowns and clarifies whether federal oversight trumps local gambling laws.
